intro: Peucedanum pricei, commonly known as the Himalayan cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbels. It typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and cooler climates. Peucedanum pricei is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
